p: Despite the well-known potential of medicinal plants in wound healing, a limited number of clinical trials are currently available, assessing the efficacy of various phytochemicals or complex extracts. Although there is a large number of pharmaceutical formulations containing vegetal extracts for the treatment of all type of wounds, some often being used since ancient times, reliable evidences are needed to demonstrate their pharmacological potential in human patients. Hence, an increased number of clinical trials and also the design of more extended studies are crucial for the evidence-based implication of plant phytochemicals, including triterpenes, in wound healing [ 172].
